cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles SW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northeast toward the Florida Panhandle, then turning east-northeast across Georgia and the Carolinas before moving offshore into the western Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm warning in effect from Navarre FL to Yankeetown FL (Gulf coast only)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, Georgia coast (including Brunswick), and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Gale-force winds possible Saturday afternoon and evening with gusts 30–40 mph, isolated higher in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the southeast Georgia coast; significant (>3 ft) surge not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could drop 2–4 inches with isolated totals near 6 inches at and around the port Saturday into early Sunday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands may briefly threaten coastal Georgia.
